subtopics.content:
• Operation Sindoor validated the strength of indigenous weaponry like Akash, Pinaka, SWATHI radar and UAVs.
• It significantly boosted global demand for Indian defence products, with exports rising to ₹23,622 crore in 2024-25 and aiming for ₹50,000 crore by 2029.

• India successfully test-fired nuclear-capable ballistic missiles Prithvi-II and Agni-I from Chandipur on July 17.
• The launches affirmed operational readiness and reinforced strategic deterrence posture.

• DRDO conducted flight trials of the UAV-Launched Precision Guided Missile (ULPGM-V3) from Kurnool range.
• Defence Minister Rajnath Singh hailed it as a major advancement in smart unmanned strike systems.
• Over 2,000 tech-transfer licenses and 200+ production licenses issued in 2024.

• DRDO announced a transformative decade-long vision to turn India into a major defence exporter.
• Projects include hypersonic BrahMos-II (Mach 8) and AMCA stealth fighter with first prototype by 2026-27.

• India is upgrading with indigenous drones (Rudrastra VTOL, MBC2 swarms), HAL’s CATS teaming system, plus surveillance imports like MQ-9B.
• AI powers systems like Indrajaal, integrated into defence infrastructure.

• EAM Jaishankar met Defence Secretary Hegseth to cement deeper defence ties.
• They discussed interoperability, co-production of Javelins & Strykers, and expanded platform integration (e.g., MQ-9B).

• India submitted a Letter of Request for joint production of FGM-148 Javelin ATGM.
• Dual-track plan: immediate imports plus long-term domestic manufacturing via BDL and JJV.

• The BrahMos-II hypersonic project advanced, with a scramjet combustor test sustaining over 1,000 seconds.
• India is among few nations pursuing Mach 8-plus missile capability.

• Defence contract for Advanced Medium Combat Aircraft (AMCA) likely between Oct 2025–Jan 2026.
• Private firms like Tata and L&T may compete; first flight planned by 2028.

• Army leadership called for readiness using indigenous drones, autonomous systems, and ecosystem collaboration.
• A drone policy framework to be rolled out by Sep-Oct 2025.

• A policy framework for drone deployment and integration is being prepared for rollout by Sept–Oct 2025.
• Designed to encourage domestic production and robust testing ecosystem.

• Pralay missile underwent successful trials demonstrating indigenous tactical strike capabilities.
• The test reflects increased precision and speed of Indian missile tech.

• Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla safely returned after his historic ISS mission.
• The Cabinet celebrated the achievement as vital for India’s Gaganyaan and space-lead aspirations.

• India deployed Bhargavastra, a layered and affordable anti-drone system using guided micro-missiles.
• Tested successfully in Odisha, enhancing swarming drone defence.

• Akashteer, BEL’s integrated air defence system, achieved perfect interception during Operation Sindoor.
• The network links radars, tracking and communications in real time.

• India announced launch of 52 defence surveillance satellites by 2029.
• Aims to enable round-the-clock monitoring of adversarial territories.

• DRDO completed the development of K-5 SLBM with a 5,000–6,000 km range.
• It enhances India’s underwater second-strike nuclear capability.

subtopics.subtopic: P-8I purchase paused amid tariff rise
subtopics.content:
• India paused buying six Boeing P-8I aircraft due to nearly 50 % price hike from US tariffs.
• Decision reflects scrutiny of high-value defence procurements.
• Leadership stressed that the Armed Forces must be 'ready now and future-ready', integrating emerging tech and unmanned systems.
• Reports highlight adoption of jointness, cyber safety, simplified acquisition and export focus as modernization themes for 2025.
• Emphasis on integrating ground and aerial sensor data via army and satellite networks to strengthen battlefield intelligence.
• Increased collaboration between DRDO, MSMEs, startups and industry under Technology Development Fund has expanded missile capabilities.

subtopics.subtopic: India eyes bigger defence export role
subtopics.content: • Following successful operations and indigenous tech, global confidence in Indian defence has surged, boosting export ambitions.
• Firms like Tata and L&T now invited into AMCA and future platforms, expanding self-reliance.
• K-5 SLBM highlights India’s enhanced second-strike capability via submarines.
• Pralay missile trials demonstrated key indigenous tactical strike capability in July.
• Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla’s safe return from ISS reinforces India’s human spaceflight trajectory.
• India plans to deploy 52 defence satellites by 2029 for round-the-clock coverage.
